medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty in controlling diabetes with three oral medications.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms M was diagnosed with diabetes in 1999 following an episode of herpes zoster. Initial treatment included diet and exercise, leading to blood glucose levels ranging from 113 to 200 mg/dL. Over time, she took glyburide, metformin, and rosiglitazone, with HbA1c values fluctuating but generally indicating poor control, reaching as high as 8.0%. Her most recent HbA1c value was 7.4%, but she expressed reluctance to begin insulin therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes (diagnosed in 1999), hypertension, lumbar disk disease, hiatal hernia, osteopenia.
medical_history.family_history: One daughter has diabetes; no other relevant family history mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, widowed for 8 years, has three children, does not smoke, and drinks alcohol socially. Engages in short walks for exercise due to back pain.
